page.title: 10STAND-BY BOATS
page.content: The majority of stand -by boats are former trawlers and crew.No longer employed in fishing due to the decline of the industry they have shifted into the oil industry.The job is certainly not glamorous nor does it attract the large wages usually synonomous with offshore work.One explanation being the national abundance of unemployed fisherman.This means that the companies can offer relatively low wages knowing that if the Aberdeen fishermen don't accept they can employ fishermen from Hull or Grimsby instead.The skipper and nine of a crew are away for 31 days followed by only 4-7 days onshore.While at sea they hover on 'stand-by' near the rig in case of emergencies such as a 'man overboard'.To relieve the boredom these former trawlermen often go off line fishing in a wee rescue dingy.
